profile_positions.description:
Leading the data-driven marketing & digital transformation as a member of the board of L'Oreal Benelux

Managed a team of 30+ experts in the field of e-com, data, consumer care, media, websites & digital services, digital IT, controlling, CRM, beauty tech & innovation, and consumer & market intelligence. 

Responsibilities:
/ Driving the development of our multi-div e-com business
/ Kickstarting and scaling new (digital) capabilities in the organisation
/ Developing the conditions to allow for data-driven decision making
/ Leading the business drivers shift towards digital and optimising marketing spendings

Co-designed and rolled out the Benelux hub project with the board. My focus: marketing & digital organisation, diversity & inclusion, agile ways of working
profile_positions.title: Chief Digital & Marketing Officer Benelux

profile_positions.description:
Leading the data-driven marketing transformation as a member of the board of L'Oreal NL. 
Managing a team of specialists in Media, E-commerce, Data, CRM, Advocacy, Digital assets & tools, Consumer Market Intelligence & Consumer Care, working on:

- Consumer at the Heart: consumer and market insights & journeys at the heart of our decision making, and developing our consumer advice department towards an omni-channel service to best service our consumers.

- Ecommerce (D2C and indirect). Facilitate the divisions for beauty e-commerce growth with the right tech ecosystem and build the inhouse capabilities to create the best (PDP) beauty content, optimize the traffic plan, generate reviews and analyse the business development. Co-create the growth strategy with each business unit to continue to outperform the e-com market growth.

- Beauty tech player. Maximize media ROI, fully leverage precision advertising, develop our data ecosystem to allow for personalisation and automation, optimise/roll out/animate our digital platforms and services, and become best in class in content across all platforms to build digital love brands.

- Marketing and digital transformation. Make the organisation future-proof by optimizing internal roles/team setup for both the marketing and digital teams, scaling up agile working, selecting the partners and tools to work with, hiring and coaching the best talents and upskilling all of our employees on the newly required skills.
profile_positions.title: Chief Digital & Marketing Officer Netherlands

profile_positions.description:
Leading the digital transformation of the Consumer Product Division in the Netherlands to make the digital ambitions of the group happen with a team of digital and brand communication experts.Mixing the entrepreneurial L’Oreal spirit with the disruptive digital spirit of test&learn the team I delivered on the following topics:

- developed growth strategies with our e-commerce partners to enhance the consumer experience and conversion rate and help transform their shops into online beauty shopping destinations. 
- set up programmatic marketing with the DoubleClick stack to optimize digital ROI and pilot with new ways of targeting and storytelling to connect with our consumers (see the movie below).
- Transforming the way we do media by shifting towards always-on; developing omni-channel touchpoint stategies, setting up native content platforms, optimizing our search and social presence and focusing on creating organic traffic and earned media (via online and offline influencers).
- Changing the structure to make these things happen, which includes: hiring expertise talents, re-assessing the responsibilities of the digital and marketing teams and challenging the agency cost structure. 
- Upskilling the marketers, sales people, digital experts and top management by developing tailor made training programs and reverse mentoring. 
- Building a digital community by connecting the different divisions to accelerate on our learning process together.
profile_positions.title: Digital Development & Communication Director

profile_positions.description:
Leading as a category expert by managing teams of 5 marketing professionals in charge of the operational execution of L'Oreal Paris brands.
- March 2012 - February 2014: haircare, hair coloration and styling
- March 2014 - February 2015: male + female skincare and suncare

Responsible for developing brand specific marketing strategies (launches, media plans, pricing, promotions, assortment mix, P&L results) often as a leader of multi-disciplinary project teams. Furthermore responsible for developing a business vision together with the category management and sales teams, and for setting and tracking budget targets.

Special achievements:
- Responsible for the development of a corporate digital communication platform for L'Oréal Paris to strengthen our image as trend expert.
- Creating and implementing a new price-promotion-shelf strategy for skincare to improve profitability and create clarity for our consumers.
- Responsible for the re-launch of StudioLine and Elnett in the Netherlands, which thoroughly improved our P&L and sell-out performance.
- Launched a new premium hair care brand in the Netherlands (Hair Expertise) to further strengthen our position in the Dutch hair care market.
- Building and implementing a brand positioning strategy for our 4 coloration brands in order to differentiate the brands for our consumers and grow all brands.
